result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandie Tywon White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To the sentence in case #15CM906.

*Review hearing scheduled for 01/08/16 at 1:15pm.
Concurrent with: With probation ordered in case #15CM906.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

*No firearms.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim without the approval or the Court or agent.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by the agent and consistent with the family court order.
* Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
*Complete a parenting class.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction consecutive to the sentence in case #15CM906.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.  Probabtion is to run concurrent to the probabtion ordered in case #15CM906.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 01/08/2016.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim without the approval or the Court or agent.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by the agent and consistent with the family court order.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.


Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On oral motion of the State, the Court ordered Count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

As to Count 1 as amended:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The state has made a new offer to defendant for resolution.  Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing.
Based upon statements to the court the court will modify contact order to be consistent with Family Court order and allow for third party contact with children.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Brandie Tywon White in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  ADA Ron Dague approved quick date.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
